location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Political Department letter no. 15 from Lieutenant-Colonel Sir Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: Stannus reports a conversation he had had at Muscat with the Imam of Muscat [Said bin Sultan al-Said] in which the Imam had stated that he had been grossly insulted by the Sheikh of Bushere [Bushire], Abdool Russool Khan [‘Abd al-Rasūl] and intended to seize the island of Kharack [Kharg] in retaliation and even attempt to get possession of Bushere itself. However, he would warn the British in advance of any undertaking by him that might affect British trade or establishments. Stannus had attempted to persuade him to adopt a more conciliatory course of action.
